VIAYN.samples.agents module¶

class VIAYN.samples.agents.BetSelectionMechanism(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: typing.Generic, abc.ABC

Abstract class for independent subcomponent of an agent that handles betting NOTE: not all agents must use betting mechanism, it’s just a useful tool

abstract select_bet_amount(state: S, action: A, money: float) → List[float]¶
Creates a bet based on the current state, the action being bet on

and the current amount of money the agent has

Parameters

  • state (S) – the current state at the time of the bet

  • action (A) – the action the agent is betting on

  • money (float) – the amount of money the agent has at the time of the bet

Returns

bet – how much money to bet on each timestep of the prediction total should sum up to less than 1, the percentage of the agent’s current total money

Return type

List[float]

Bases: VIAYN.samples.agents.PredictionSelectionMechanism

Uniformly selects a prediction within the valid range for each timestep. Intended to be used as part of a CompositeAgent

select_prediction(state: S, action: A, money: float) → List[float]¶

Makes a random prediction starting @ the next timestep Selected uniformly from range of possible predictions at that timestep :param state: ignored :type state: S :param action: ignored :type action: A :param money: ignored :type money: float

Returns

prediction – the predictions that the agent wants to put in the best at the current timestep

Return type

List[float]

VIAYN.samples.payout module¶

class VIAYN.samples.payout.PayoutConfigBase(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: VIAYN.project_types.PayoutConfiguration

Optional base class that other PayoutConfigurations can extend from. Present so that we can avoid having duplicate code.

calculate_all_payouts(record: VIAYN.project_types.HistoryItem[A, S], welfare_score: float, t_current: int) → Dict[VIAYN.project_types.Agent[A, S], float]¶

Calculates how much money each agent should get for their bets that were cast in record

Parameters

  • record (HistoryItem[A, S]) – record of all bets that were cast for a single timestep that are now eligible for payouts

  • welfare_score (float) – the current welfare score that the agents were trying to predict

  • t_current (int) – the timestep @ which the welfare score was recorded

Returns

payouts – how much money each agent earned from their bets in this record

Return type

Dict[Agent[A, S], float]

validate_bet(bet: VIAYN.project_types.WeightedBet[A, S]) → bool¶
class VIAYN.samples.payout.SimplePayoutConfig(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: VIAYN.samples.payout.PayoutConfigBase

calculate_loss(bet_to_evaluate: VIAYN.project_types.WeightedBet, t_cast_on: int, t_current: int, welfare_score: float) → float¶

Calculates ‘how far off’ the agents were from correctly predicting the welfare_score. Mostly useful for example & potential use in calculate_all_payouts

Parameters

  • bet_to_evaluate (WeightedBet[A, S]) – the bet that we are calculating the loss on

  • t_cast_on (int) – the timestep that the bet was cast on

  • t_current (int) – the timestep that the evaluation is being made on should be the same as the timestep corresponding to welfare score

  • welfare_score –

Returns

loss – how far off the predictions were

Return type

float >= 0

calculate_payout_from_loss(bet_amount_to_evaluate: float, loss_to_evaluate: float, all_losses: List[Tuple[float, float]], t_cast_on: int, t_current: int, action_bet_on: A, action_selected: A) → float¶
class VIAYN.samples.payout.SuggestedPayoutConfig(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: VIAYN.samples.payout.PayoutConfigBase

loss = squared error between prediction and welfare_score payout = weight_i * (max_loss - loss_i) / (max_loss - weighted_mean_loss) where weighted mean is calculated by weights

VIAYN.samples.policy module¶

class VIAYN.samples.policy.GreedyPolicyConfiguration(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: VIAYN.project_types.PolicyConfiguration

Selects the action with the highest weighted mean predicted value. Predicted value is summed evenly across all timesteps. Those values are then weighted by the standard weights of people who cast them

action_probabilities(aggregate_bets: Dict[A, float]) → Dict[A, float]¶

Deterministic policy, so the action with the highest expectation has 100% TODO: does this work with ties?

Parameters

aggregate_bets (Dict[A, float]) – the weighted mean of predictions for each action

Returns

probabilities – the probability of each action being selected

Return type

Dict[A, float]

aggregate_bets(predictions: Dict[A, List[VIAYN.project_types.WeightedBet[A, S]]]) → Dict[A, float]¶

Sums across all timesteps and then takes the weighted mean for each action

Parameters

predictions (Dict[A, List[WeightedBet[A, S]]]) – the bets cast for each action

Returns

expectations – the weighted mean of predictiosn for each action

class VIAYN.samples.policy.ThompsonPolicyBase(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: VIAYN.project_types.PolicyConfiguration

Contains base infrastructure that is used for both ThompsonPayoutConfiguration and ThompsonPayoutConfiguration2

action_probabilities(aggregate_bets: Dict[A, B]) → Dict[A, float]¶

Estimates the probabilities of taking each action by Monte Carlo sampling because a closed form solution is very computationally expensive

Parameters

aggregate_bets (Dict[A, B]) – aggregated information about bet distributions. Type of B is different for each version of ThompsonConfiguration

Returns

probabilities – the monte-carlo estimate of how often each action is chosen

Return type

Dict[A, float]

abstract aggregate_bets(predictions: Dict[A, List[VIAYN.project_types.WeightedBet[A, S]]]) → Dict[A, B]¶

Computes some aggregate statistics about the predictions made. The decisions about what action to take must be made SOLELY off of these aggregate statistics

Parameters

predictions (Dict[A, List[WeightedBet[A, S]]]) – predictions to aggregate statistics for for each action

Returns

stats – mapping from actions to aggregated stats of the predictions about them

Return type

Dict[A, B]

abstract select_action(aggregate_bets: Dict[A, B]) → A¶

Based on the statistics about the actions, selects an action to take May be non-deterministic

Parameters

aggregate_bets (Dict[A, B]) – statistics about each action. E.g. weighted mean of predictions => B = float

Returns

action – the selected action

Return type

A

validate_bet(bet: VIAYN.project_types.WeightedBet[A, S]) → bool¶
class VIAYN.samples.policy.ThompsonPolicyConfiguration(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: VIAYN.samples.policy.ThompsonPolicyBase

NOTE: because we made the decision to support the possibility of different bets @ each timestep this code enacts a slightly different version of Thompson Sampling than described in the whitepaper Namely, for each action it generates a list of discrete distributions according to the distribution @ that timestep. It then samples from that distribution @ each timestep and sums the samples. These sums of samples are used to compare actions In principle, this likely reduces the variance of the sampling process and is computationally more expensive than what we could use if we know that all of the bets are the same for all timesteps in a single timestepsA

Alternate Explanation: For each action & each timestep, constructs a DiscreteDistribution from the predictions. Then samples from each of those discrete distributions to obtain a single prediction for the value of that action at that timestep.

All timesteps are then summed together, and the action with the highest total value is chosen.

aggregate_bets(predictions: Dict[A, List[VIAYN.project_types.WeightedBet[A, S]]]) → Dict[A, List[VIAYN.DiscreteDistribution.DiscreteDistribution]]¶

Computes some aggregate statistics about the predictions made. The decisions about what action to take must be made SOLELY off of these aggregate statistics

Parameters

predictions (Dict[A, List[WeightedBet[A, S]]]) – predictions to aggregate statistics for for each action

Returns

stats – mapping from actions to aggregated stats of the predictions about them

Return type

Dict[A, B]

select_action(aggregate_bets: Dict[A, List[VIAYN.DiscreteDistribution.DiscreteDistribution]]) → A¶

Based on the statistics about the actions, selects an action to take May be non-deterministic

Parameters

aggregate_bets (Dict[A, B]) – statistics about each action. E.g. weighted mean of predictions => B = float

Returns

action – the selected action

Return type

A

class VIAYN.samples.policy.ThompsonPolicyConfiguration2(*args, **kwds)¶

Bases: VIAYN.samples.policy.ThompsonPolicyBase

ThompsonSampling as I originally planned it to be. Assumes all values in a given WeightedBet’s bet are the same

First sums each prediction over all timesteps, then uses that, combined with the bet amount to generate a single DiscreteDistribution per action. Then, samples the discrete distribution for each action & selects the action with the highest sampled value.

aggregate_bets(predictions: Dict[A, List[VIAYN.project_types.WeightedBet[A, S]]]) → Dict[A, VIAYN.DiscreteDistribution.DiscreteDistribution]¶

Computes some aggregate statistics about the predictions made. The decisions about what action to take must be made SOLELY off of these aggregate statistics

Parameters

predictions (Dict[A, List[WeightedBet[A, S]]]) – predictions to aggregate statistics for for each action

Returns

stats – mapping from actions to aggregated stats of the predictions about them

Return type

Dict[A, B]
